text: Namkha () is a largest rural municipality (by area) of Nepal located in Humla District of Karnali Province. The total area of the rural municipality is and total population is 3900 individuals (as of 2011 Nepal census) only. The rural municipality is divided into 6 wards. The rural municipality was established on 10 March 2017, when Government of Nepal restricted all old administrative structure (Village development committee) and announced 744 local level units (although the number increased to 753 later) as per the new constitution of Nepal 2015. Hepka, Khagalgaun, Muchu and Limi Village development committees were incorporated to form this new rural municipality. The headquarters of the municipality is situated at Yalwang (Muchu). ==Ward Profile== {| class="wikitable" |+ Namkha HQ:Yalbang |- ! Ward No. !! Village !! Area (km2) !!
